title: Simon Hellholm
text:
Simon Hellholm (born 24 February 1997) is a <a href="Sweden">Swedish</a> <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a> player. He is currently playing with <a href="Link%C3%B6pings%20HC">Linköpings HC</a> of the <a href="Swedish%20Hockey%20League">Swedish Hockey League</a> (SHL).
Career.
Born in <a href="Link%C3%B6ping%2C%20Sweden">Linköping, Sweden</a>, Hellholm played <a href="junior%20ice%20hockey">junior hockey</a>, with local team <a href="Link%C3%B6pings%20HC">Linköpings HC</a>. In 2011–12, he debuted at the under-16 level as a 15-year-old, playing fifteenth games in the J16 Elit. The following season he dressed for fourteen U-18 games, recording four goals and three assists. He also competed with a regional all-star team from Östergötland in the annual <a href="TV-pucken">TV-pucken</a>, an under-15 national tournament, and notched seven goals and four assists over eight games. In 2013–14, Hellholm played eight games with Linköpings HC's <a href="J20%20SuperElit">J20 SuperElit</a> team. After two impressive seasons in the J20 SuperElit; appearing in 87 regular season games, and recording 48 points. Hellholm logged his first minutes in Sweden's top-flight SHL.
